member.summary: Configuration class allowing to customize DI container used by LightBDD.

member.summary: Returns configured .

member.summary: Sets as a container to be used by LightBDD scenarios and steps.

member.summary: Sets as a container to be used by LightBDD scenarios and steps.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Core.Configuration.DependencyContainerConfiguration.UseDefaultContainer(System.Action{LightBDD.Core.Dependencies.ContainerConfigurator})
member.summary:
Configures the LightBDD to use it's default implementation of DI container. If specified, the function is used to configure the container.
The default DI container features are:
* it allows to resolve types (classes and structures) with 1 public constructor,
* it supports constructor dependency injections,
* it supports singleton registrations with ,
* it supports disposal of dependencies upon disposal, if dependency implements interface,
* it supports container scopes.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Core.Configuration.DependencyContainerConfiguration.UseDefault(System.Action{LightBDD.Core.Dependencies.IDefaultContainerConfigurator})
member.summary:
Configures the LightBDD to use it's default implementation of DI container. If specified, the function is used to configure the container.
The default DI container features are:
* automatic resolution of types (classes and structures) with 1 public constructor,
* customizable resolution of types using factory method,
* constructor dependency injections,
* single, scenario, local and transient registrations,
* disposal of dependencies implementing interface,
* container to manage instances within global, scenario, nested local scopes.

member.summary: Interface describing dependency container that is able to resolve dependencies as well as create inner scopes.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Core.Dependencies.IDependencyContainer.BeginScope(System.Action{LightBDD.Core.Dependencies.ContainerConfigurator})
member.summary: Creates new scope based on the current container and the additional if specified. The exact behavior of the new scopes will depend on the implementation, but there is a general expectation that objects resolved with the new scope should be disposed with scope disposal. The created scope should be disposed after use and should be disposed before the parent scope.
member.param: An additional configuration that, if specified, should be applied on the scope.

member.summary: Interface describing dependency container that is able to resolve dependencies as well as create inner scopes.

member.summary: Creates a new container scope based on the current scope. The new scope can be customized with additional . The exact behavior of the new scopes will depend on the implementation, but there is a general expectation that objects resolved with the new scope should be disposed with scope disposal. The created scope should be disposed after use and should be disposed before the parent scope.
member.param: An additional configuration that, if specified, should be applied on the scope.

member.summary: Instance scope describing how given instance is shared between dependencies resolved within same and nested lifetime scopes.

member.summary: The same instance is returned for requests within the root and nested scopes.

member.name: F:LightBDD.Core.Dependencies.InstanceScope.Local
member.summary: The same instance is returned for requests within the given scope, however not shared with nested scopes. Each scope will receive one instance upon request.

member.name: F:LightBDD.Core.Dependencies.InstanceScope.Transient
member.summary: The new instance is returned upon every request.

member.name: F:LightBDD.Core.Dependencies.InstanceScope.Scenario
member.summary:
The instance is shared within given scenario scope and across all nested scopes, but instantiated independently between scenarios.
The instance definition will be ignored when resolution request is made outside of the scenario.

member.name: P:LightBDD.Core.Dependencies.InstanceScope.LifetimeScopeRestriction
member.summary:
that given instance definition is applicable from, or null if instance is applicable from the container scope it was registered against. In most scenarios this value is null, thus the dependency registration is applied on the current container.
If specified, the dependency registration will become applicable from the first matching container lifetime scope (i.e. current or nested).

member.name: M:LightBDD.Core.Execution.Coordination.FeatureCoordinator.Install(LightBDD.Core.Execution.Coordination.FeatureCoordinator)
member.summary: Installs the specified feature coordinator in thread safe manner. The installed instance will be used by LightBDD to coordinate tests execution and generate reports upon disposal. It is only possible to have one installed instance at given time, however upon disposal, the coordinator uninstalls self, allowing to install new one if needed and start another test cycle.
member.exception: Exception thrown if another coordinator is already installed.

member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Core.Execution.Coordination.FeatureCoordinator.Dispose
member.summary:
Disposes coordinator, triggering feature result aggregation. Each runner belonging to , is disposed and its feature result is aggregated. After aggregation of all results, the feature aggregator is disposed as well.
If coordinator is installed as LightBDD main coordinator, it is uninstalled as well, allowing a new one to be installed in future. If coordinator is already disposed, methods does nothing.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Core.Execution.IExecutable.ConfigureExecutionAbortOnSubStepException(System.Func{System.Exception,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Allows to install function specifying if given exception should abort execution of other sub-steps belonging to current scenario or step. If function return false, the remaining sub-steps will be executed. Any suppressed exceptions would be provided to parent step/scenario after step group execution. If any sub-step execution finish with failed status, an will be thrown with exceptions of all failed sub-steps. If none sub-steps failed but there are some with ignored status, the exception of first ignored sub-step would be thrown in order to properly ignore test in underlying test framework.
member.param: Function returning true if given exception should abort further execution or should allow to execute further sub-steps within group.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Core.Formatting.Diagnostics.ObjectFormatter.Dump``1(``0,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns text representation of the object, including it's fields and properties.
The method returns the type of provided item, followed by the list of fields' and properties' names and values.
Each type member pair is space separated.
The string type is wrapped with "", null values are represented as null, primitives are formatted as is using , the arrays are wrapped with [] and complex objects are represented by {}. When is reached, the complex objects are represented as {...}.
member.param: Max depth of item's members to include in result string

member.summary: Constructor initializing formatter with stack trace lines limit equal 8 and default member exclusions.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Core.Formatting.ExceptionFormatting.DefaultExceptionFormatter.Format(System.Exception)
member.summary: Formats the exception by returning exception type name and message, followed by inner exception chain, followed by call stack information. The stack trace information can be shortened by filtering out members (any call entries starting with specified text) configured with () and number of printed lines configured with ().

member.name: M:LightBDD.Core.Formatting.ExceptionFormatting.DefaultExceptionFormatter.WithMembersExcludedFromStackTrace(System.String[])
member.summary:
Adds regex patterns to a list of members that should be excluded from printing when stack trace is rendered. Each pattern will be used to filter out stack trace lines starting with at ... where at prefix should not be added to the pattern.
The method has additive effect and can be used many times.
member.param: Patterns to be used to filter out stack trace lines starting with at ... prefix

member.name: M:LightBDD.Core.Formatting.ExceptionFormatting.DefaultExceptionFormatter.WithAllMembersIncludedOnStackTrace
member.summary: Clears all stack trace members exclusions (the default exclusions will be cleared as well) and removes the line limit.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Core.Formatting.ExceptionFormatting.DefaultExceptionFormatter.WithStackTraceLinesLimit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies limit of the printed stack trace lines. By default it is set to 4 lines per exception.
member.param: Maximum number of lines that will be printed

member.name: T:LightBDD.Core.Formatting.TimeFormatter
member.summary: Extension methods for formatting TimeSpan values.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Core.Formatting.TimeFormatter.FormatPretty(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
This method returns up to 2 most meaningful time components of given time, to make it most readable. Maximal supported time component is 'day', while the minimal is 'millisecond'. TimeSpan value being less than 1ms but larger than 0 would be presented as <1ms.
Example values:
1d 12h
5h
5m 02s
2s 527ms
<1ms
0ms
